title.narrative: GOVERNMENT CAPACITY TO LEGISLATE, COORDINATE, PLAN AND ENFORCE CHILD PROT

description.narrative: Government institutions have the capacity to legislate, plan, coordinate, budget and enforce child protection at all levels., which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023 all girls and boys, including adolescents in all settings, are protected from violence, neglect, abandonment and exploitation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government institutions have the capacity to legislate, plan, coordinate, budget and enforce child protection at all levels.

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed content on Rwanda to the Day of General Discussion (DGD) of the Committee of the Rights of the Child, whose focus in 2021 is on Children’s Rights and Alternative Care. UNICEF supported cross-sector coordination by participating in the child development sub-cluster quarterly coordination meetings, in addition to the quarterly coordination of districts’ CPWOs. The regional childcare reform learning platform established in 2020 with the UNICEF regional office progressed well. The planned investment case has not yet been carried out – it awaits results from the child protection system assessment currently underway. ; | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/12/2021
